page.title: 18 Weston during the war
page.content: It was a very long time before things returned to normal. There were still shortages of many things. Ration books for food and clothing were still in use. There were open spaces in Weston where buildings had been destroyed in bombing raids. Many houses, shops and churches disappeared and there was a long period of cleaning up and rebuilding. Everyone was glad that the war was over but it was a long time before the men and women returned home. A bomb was dropped behind our house and lots of our windows were boken. My grandad was stationed at Malta when the war ended and did not return to England until 1946. But he was still in the Royal Navy until 1951. As soon as the war was over people were allowed to take down the blackout curtains and lights shone again.
